results.title: Inert(?) gas compounds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
The first synthesis of krypton difluoride is traced from its inspiration to the first tentative success. Krypton difluoride is prepared by photolysis of fluorine in solid krypton at the temperature of liquid hydrogen and identified by its infrared spectrum.

results.title: Industries of the future
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, David Tapper and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the course of industry, technology and invention during the coming century. Examines the kind of innovations that will shape the civilisation of the future. Studies the opportunities and changes that will arise from the development of an industrially and scientifically oriented society. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Industrial weight lifter
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct method of lifting heavy objects. A flexible model simulating the human backbone is used to illustrate how discs are “pinched” when weights are lifted while the backbone is curved. Good posture, positioning, and smooth application of lifting power are shown. Demonstrations point out that using the powerful leg muscles with the back straight and vertical increases lifting power. Extremely heavy items can only be handled with a special lifting device.

results.title: Industrial relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Ron Edwards of Melbourne College of Advanced Education interviews Simon Crean (ACTU), John Halfpenny (Australian Metalworkers Union), Kerry Klineberg (Chamber of Manufacturers) and Andrew Hay (Federation of Employers) on different ways of solving industrial relations problems.

results.title: Industrial provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: Ontario and Quebec, as the main industrial provinces of Canada, link Canada with the United States of America, and with the rest of the world, through the products of their industries. Mining, manufacturing, and agriculture in these two provinces make them vitally important to the well-being of the other Canadian provinces.

results.title: Industrial preparation of acetic acid (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Describes the process of making acetic acid, by the oxidation of naphtha with air, in a large industrial chemicals factory. Outlines the various stages in developing the process, including laboratory research and pilot plant development.

results.title: Industrial power service
results.brief_description: An outline of the characteristics and advantages of pneumatic power across a wide range of industries. Shows how air tools can perform a wide range of tasks from polishing to rivetting.
